content.user_title: Set up isolated git worktrees for parallel development
content.value_statement: Managing multiple features in one repository is challenging when workspace switching disrupts your flow. This skill creates isolated git worktrees that let you work on multiple branches simultaneously with automatic safety checks and setup verification.
actual_capabilities: Create isolated git worktrees with smart directory detection
Auto-detect project-local or global worktree locations
Verify .gitignore safety before creating project-local worktrees
Auto-run project setup commands (npm, cargo, poetry, go)
Run baseline tests to verify clean worktree state
Integrate with brainstorming and execution planning workflows
limitations: Requires git version 2.5 or later for worktree support
Does not manage worktree cleanup or deletion
Cannot create worktrees without an existing git repository

use_cases.title: Parallel feature development
use_cases.description: Work on multiple features simultaneously without switching branches or stashing changes

use_cases.title: Isolated code review
use_cases.description: Check out pull request branches in separate worktrees without disturbing your main development

use_cases.title: Clean test environments
use_cases.description: Create pristine test environments for each branch with verified baseline test runs

best_practices: Always verify .gitignore before creating project-local worktrees to prevent accidental commits
Run baseline tests immediately to establish a known-good state before making changes
Follow directory priority: existing directories > CLAUDE.md preferences > user preference
anti_patterns: Skipping .gitignore verification - leads to worktree contents being accidentally tracked
Proceeding with failing baseline tests - makes it impossible to distinguish new bugs from pre-existing issues
Hardcoding worktree directory locations instead of following project conventions

faq.question: What git version is required for worktrees?
faq.answer: Git version 2.5 or later is required. Check with git --version. Most modern git installations support worktrees.

faq.question: Can I use worktrees outside my project directory?
faq.answer: Yes. You can use ~/.config/superpowers/worktrees/<project-name>/ for global worktrees that live completely outside the project repository.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: The using-git-worktrees skill integrates with brainstorming, executing-plans, and subagent-driven-development for isolated implementation work.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using worktrees?
faq.answer: Worktrees are safe. This skill verifies .gitignore before creating project-local worktrees to prevent accidental commits of worktree contents.

faq.question: What happens if tests fail during baseline verification?
faq.answer: Report the failures to the user and ask whether to proceed with investigation or continue anyway. Never proceed silently with failing tests.

faq.question: How is this different from cloning the repository?
faq.answer: Worktrees share the same .git directory, so they use minimal disk space. Changes sync instantly between worktrees without pushing or pulling.
